title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: The user reported that selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the Java editor takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original. This process is significantly slower compared to closing and reopening the file.
OB: When the user opens a file in the Java editor, makes changes, and selects 'Revert' from the pop-up menu, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The expected behavior is that selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu should be as fast as or comparable to closing and reopening the file in the Java editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt'. 
2) Make changes to the file. 
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab and select 'No' when prompted to save changes. 
4) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 
5) Repeat steps 1) and 2). 
6) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. 
7) Observe that it takes 15 seconds for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original version of the file.
